usa: The United States Department of Veterans Affairs was established.<sup id="cite_ref-552" class="reference">[552]</sup>
Exxon Valdez oil spill: An oil tanker struck a reef in Prince William Sound, spilling over 11 million gallons of crude oil in the Gulf of Alaska.[553]
Speaker of the House Jim Wright becomes the first House Speaker to resign amid scandal; he was succeeded by Tom Foley.<sup id="cite_ref-554" class="reference">[554]</sup>
Hurricane Hugo struck the East Coast, killing 49 people and causing $7 billion in damage.[555][556]
The Loma Prieta earthquake, striking the San Francisco Bay Area and interrupting the 1989 World Series, killed sixty-three people.[557]
Malta Summit: President Bush and Soviet Premier Gorbachev met in Malta weeks after the fall of the Berlin Wall, releasing statements indicating that the war may be coming to an end.[558]

Operation Just Cause: 26,000 U.S. military personnel were deployed in the U.S. invasion of Panama, removing Military Governor Manuel Noriega from power and restoring Panama's democratically elected government.[559]
The Office of National Drug Control Policy was established.[560]
